articles.author: NWA Online
articles.summary: Apple is suspending an error-prone feature that used artificial intelligence to deliver bogus news alerts to some iPhone owners. It's been a problem for some people for some time and Apple is taking action to fix it now. It used to deliver false news alerts on some iPhones.

articles.title: Fearing AI will take their jobs, California workers plan a long battle against tech
articles.author: KHARI JOHNSON Cal Matters
articles.summary: The current frenzy around artificial intelligence has spread like a shockwave. It started among engineers inspired by a 2017 research paper. Next came venture capitalists eager to profit from a new boom. They were followed by government officials racing to impose regulations. It's all about money now.

articles.title: Apple suspends AI news feature
articles.author: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
articles.summary: Apple is disabling the AI-generated feature for news and entertainment while it tries to fix the issue. The BBC was among the media organizations that complained about the balky news summary feature. Google had to retool a new version of its search engine last year because of similar issues.

articles.title: ChatGPT Introduces Customizable Traits Like âChatty' and âGen Z' for Personalized AI Interactions
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI chatbot developed by OpenAI. On January 17, 2025, OpenAI rolled out a new custom instructions feature for ChatGPT. The update allows users to specify traits for the chatbot, including its personality and communication style. It's available on ChatGpt.com and the Windows desktop app, with plans to expand to mobile and MacOS platforms in the following weeks.

articles.title: 'ELIZA,' the world's 1st chatbot, was just resurrected from 60-year-old computer code
articles.author: Kristina Killgrove
articles.summary: Scientists have just resurrected "ELIZA," the world's first chatbot, from long-lost computer code. They used dusty printouts from MIT archives to bring it back to life. ELIZA was developed in the 1960s by MIT professor Joseph Weizenbaum and named for Eliza Doolittle, the protagonist of "Pygmalion"

articles.title: Want to Stay Ahead in 2025? Master AI with These 8 Free Courses (No Credit Card Required)
articles.author: Elisabeta Qoku
articles.summary: Google, Harvard, and Microsoft are offering free AI courses to help business owners get the hang of it without emptying their wallet.    AI is powerful but it's also important to know how to use it responsibly. If you're too busy to sit through the courses, book a free strategy session with the experts to help you set up AI-powered solutions.

articles.title: Mira Murati, a former high-ranking ChatGPT exec, has a mysterious AI project of her own
articles.summary: Mira Murati is a prominent AI engineer who worked on several projects at OpenAI. Now she's starting her own AI startup. She hired 10 researchers and engineers from OpenAI, Character AI, and Google DeepMind. Jonathan Lachman, the former head of special projects, left OpenAI recently to join Murati's startup.

articles.title: Darrin Bell, Pulitzer Prize-winning cartoonist, appears in court Friday
articles.author: Lee Anne Denyer
articles.summary: Cartoonist Darrin Bell is accused of possessing child pornography. Bell won the Pulitzer Prize for cartooning in 2019. Under new law, child sexual abuse material (CSAM) can be prosecuted under the same parameters as other child pornography under new California law.

articles.title: American Writers & Artists Institute (AWAI) Sent This Writer 108 Emails!
articles.summary: American Writers & Artists Institute (AWAI) sells training sessions on copywriting. Barbara has received 108 emails in less than 3 months by their organization and 5 different people promoting their products. She has complained about them to bbb.org. Angela is the publisher of WritersWeekly.com and the CEO of BookLocker.com.

articles.title: Thread by @NovavoidW53519 on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: The human mind was developed over millions of years to be the smartest thing on the planet. The human mind also developed to remember things it USES, aside from schooling how often have you needed to use a non labeled map of the united states? If you need consistency use a globe, if you want knowledge use a fucking globe.

articles.title: Apple pulls error-prone AI feature after it generated fake news alerts
articles.author: bamaap
articles.summary: Apple is disabling the AI-generated feature for news and entertainment while it tries to fix the issue. The BBC was among the media organizations that complained about the balky news summary feature. Google had to retool a new version of its search engine last year because of erroneous information.

articles.title: How Are Coronado Businesses Using AI to Stay Profitable?
articles.author: Promoted Partner
articles.summary: Coronado businesses are using AI to improve their operations and stay ahead of the curve. The integration of AI is reshaping the way local businesses operate. It's not just about saving money, but about making smarter, bolder moves that help businesses thrive in a hyper-competitive world.

articles.title: Police departments are turning to AI-powered facial recognition technology â leading to a rise in WRONGFUL ARRESTS
articles.author: Tags
articles.summary: Police departments are turning to AI-powered facial recognition technology to identify and arrest suspects. There have been at least eight documented cases of wrongful arrests in the U.S. made based on information from AI facial recognition software. Facial recognition algorithms struggle with low-quality images, poor lighting and unusual angles and exhibits significant biases, particularly against women and people of color.

articles.title: The Discerning Investor: FINRA Warns About Generative AI
articles.author: Julie Jason
articles.summary: According to the FBI, artificial intelligence (AI) can be used as a weapon to commit fraud. According to FINRA, you need to protect your investment accounts from "generative artificial intelligence" or Gen AI. The best advice is to use a password manager and to monitor your account activity regularly.

articles.title: Apple pulls beta AI feature that inaccurately summarized news headlines
articles.author: bamaap
articles.summary: Apple is disabling the AI-generated feature for news and entertainment while it tries to fix the issue causing the technology to fabricate information. Similar software updates for Apple's iPad and Mac computers are also in a testing phase. The BBC complained about the balky news summary feature after Apple sent alerts that transformed its reports into false headlines.

articles.title: OpenAI Has Created an AI Model For Longevity Science
articles.author: Slashdot
articles.summary: OpenAI has developed a language model for engineering proteins capable of converting regular cells into stem cells. It is the company's first venture into biological data. It demonstrates AI's potential for unexpected scientific discoveries.    - An anonymous reader quotes a report from MIT Technology Review.

articles.title: Biden's New Executive Order Allows AI Data Center Construction On Federal Land
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: President Joe Biden signed an executive order to establish artificial intelligence (AI) data centers on six federal property sites. The centers are expected to be operational within the next five to ten years.   Ã  Â    for Investor Brand Network.

articles.title: Should AI movies be considered art, be eligible for copyright protection?
articles.author: Korea Times
articles.summary: "It's Me, Moon-hee" is a groundbreaking artificial intelligence (AI) film featuring AI-generated actor Na Moon-hee firing a gun. It has gained attention not only for its creative premise but also for its revolutionary production process. It's called "Do You Really Know Her".

articles.title: CM: AI & IT to make radical changes, boost âEase of Living'
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Devendra Fadnavis says the state government aims to make radical changes in the health sector, agriculture, and rural development to improve the 'Ease of Living' of the citizens with the help of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Information Technology (IT).

articles.title: Samsung's Galaxy S25 Ultra Will Unlock An AI Revolution
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Samsung will update Galaxy AI with the Galaxy S25 Ultra and S25. Samsung will also update Galaxy S20 and S20 Plus. Samsung is developing an AI-powered smartphone. Samsung wants to define AI phones in 2025 and beyond. Samsung plans to release Galaxy AI in 2018.

articles.title: These are Sam Altman's predictions on how the world might change with AI
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Sam Altman is the CEO of one of the buzziest AI companies, OpenAI. He has predicted AI systems that are generally smarter than humans for The New York Times and for the Guardian newspaper.   Â    i.e. AI systems with higher intelligence than humans.

articles.title: What Are AI Agent Coins? Utility, Autonomy, and Blockchain Power
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: The fusion of artificial intelligence (AI) and cryptocurrencies has been a hot topic in the past year. It has led to a rise in the use of AI and cryptocurrencies in the market. It's also led to the development of new financial services.

articles.title: Beyond Transformers: New AI Architectures Could Revolutionize Large Language Models
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: Two new neural network designs promise to make AI models more adaptable and efficient. They could change the way artificial intelligence learns and evolves.    -  Â    for more information visit: http://www.aia.org/news/features/top-stories/ai-intelligence-technologies-technologies-technological-advances/

articles.title: World's First AI Chatbot, ELIZA, Resurrected After 60 Years
articles.author: Slashdot
articles.summary: Scientists have just resurrected the world's first chatbot from long-lost computer code from MIT archives using dusty printouts from the archives. It still works very well.   ...  .   "ELIZA" is a chatbot.

articles.title: OpenAI finalises 'o3 mini' reasoning AI model version, to launch it soon
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: OpenAI is set to launch its new reasoning AI model 'o3 mini' in two weeks. It plans to simultaneously release the API and the AI model's codebase. It will be called OpenAI's O3 Mini.   Ã

articles.title: AI is Empowering Shipowners to Tackle New Safety Management Challenges
articles.author: The Maritime Executive
articles.summary: The maritime industry is undergoing a digital transformation. One of the key innovations is the integration of artificial intelligence into safety management systems. The increased documentation required following the gamut of new rules and procedures place increasing demands on seafarers. Seafarers are faced with an overwhelming amount of information and documentation to manage.

articles.title: Ex-Israeli spies involved in Gaza genocide building AI systems for global tech companies
articles.author: Press TV
articles.summary: Israel's Unit 8200 is building artificial intelligence (AI) systems that helped the regime commit the genocide against Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip. According to a report, the team is building AI systems for global tech and AI companies. Unit 8 200 also built India's first AI-based firing system.

articles.title: OpenAI Finalizes 'o3 mini' Reasoning AI Model Version, To Launch It Soon
articles.author: NDTV
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI has finalized a version of its new reasoning AI model o3 mini and will launch it in a couple of weeks. CEO Sam Altman said on Friday that the new AI model will be called O3 mini. It will be based on OpenAI's AI model.

articles.title: Before Apple's AI Went Haywire and Started Making Up Fake News, Its Engineers Warned of ...
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Apple's news summaries have been criticized for botching headlines and reporting false information. This week Apple is trying to replicate the reasoning steps observed in their training data. Apple Intelligence has been disappointing. Apple's recent stab at AI, Apple Intelligence, has received widespread criticism.

articles.title: Gary Numan admits he's 'fascinated and horrified in equal measure' about AI in music
articles.author: Music News
articles.summary: Gary Numan's upcoming album is dedicated to artificial intelligence and how it might impact humanity. He predicts that the future could see AI artists appearing onstage in a similar vein to ABBA's. He is both "fascinated and horrified" about the use of AI in music.

articles.title: AI-based technology could reduce number of controversial decisions in boxing
articles.author: Kamran Mahroof
articles.summary: Kamran Mahroof and Saima Sammad write for The Conversation that boxing is a theatre of skill, power and drama that has captivated audiences for centuries. Behind the allure of championship nights and historic rivalries lies an experimental AI scoring system.

articles.title: New missions are carrying innovative technology, and a little red house, to the moon
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Landing on the moon is one of the most challenging things humanity has attempted. Private companies are aiming for a moon landing. For Intuitive Machines, it's genetically engineering a novel organism to fulfill the functions, theoretically, of an extant (living) organism.

articles.title: Mira Murati, a former high-ranking ChatGPT exec, has a mysterious AI project of her own
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: Mira Murati worked on several of OpenAI's products, including ChatGPT, which started the AI revolution in late 2022. She served as the company's CTO until her departure last September. Murati was the interim CEO of the company during the coup in late November 2023.

articles.title: Fox News AI Newsletter: China gains ground
articles.author: Fox News
articles.summary: US must win AI race as China gains ground, according to OpenAI's Chris Lehane. AI scammers pretending to be Brad Pitt con woman out of $850,000 by tricking her into giving her a false identity to steal the money from Brad Pitt.

articles.title: "Suchir Balaji Was ": OpenAI On Whistleblower Amid Mother's 'Murder' Claims
articles.author: NDTV
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI reacted to whistleblower Suchir Balaji's death, saying that he was a "valued member" of their team. Balaji worked for ChatGPT until his death on Friday.   .   for OpenAI.

articles.title: Open AI on whistleblower Suchir Balaji's death, his mother's âmurder' claim: âHeartbroken'
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Suchir Balaji was a researcher-turned-whistleblower at Open AI. He died in 2018. Open AI is still 'heartbroken' by his passing. It won't be commenting further.   .  Â    "

articles.title: Cognizant Study Shows Consumers Who Embrace AI Could Drive $4.4 Trillion in Spending Over Five Years
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Joint study between Cognizant and Oxford Economics predicts AI will drive 46% of consumer transactions in the U.S. by 2030. Business need to leverage AI to reimagine customer experiences, according to the study. Cognizants is a subsidiary of CTSH.

articles.title: Making financial decisions using Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Bridgewise uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help potential investors make sound decisions on their investments. The company uses its own proprietary AI model to help close the information gap in financial markets.   Â Bridewise calls itself a "technological research company"

articles.title: 'Valued member': OpenAI breaks silence on whistleblower Suchir Balaji's death after 'murder' allegations
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: ChatGPT developer OpenAI issued a statement over the death of whistleblower Suchir Balaji. They acknowledged Balaji's contributions to the company and assured cooperation with authorities. Open AI said, 'Suchir was a valued member of our team and they attacked him and killed him'

articles.title: Microsoft opens testing for Windows AI search
articles.author: The Verge
articles.summary: Microsoft is testing AI-powered Windows search in a new dev channel build for Windows 11 Insider testers. It uses semantic indexing to let users search for local files using more casual language. It will gradually roll out to Windows Insiders on Snapdragon-powered Copilot+ PCs.

articles.title: How Trump Can Make AI Safe - Inside Sources
articles.author: Judd Rosenblatt
articles.summary: $200 billion was spent on AI model training in 2024, equivalent to nearly a quarter of America's military budget. OpenAI employees predict AI could replace most intellectual labor within 18 months. Jacob Helberg is calling for a Manhattan Project-style program to build AI systems that serve U.S. interests and values.
